treatment.reference: Nutritional Requirements of Methanomicrobium mobile AEM 54:625-628
treatment.description: Growth was dependent on acetate, isobutyrate, isovalerate, and 2-methylbutyrate. Sources of the branched-chain amino acids (yeast extract, Trypticase, and vitamin-free Casamino Acids) did not substitute for any of the branched-chain volatile fatty acids required. Yeast extract (1 g/liter) was required for the growth. Indole or tryptophan required for growth. Growth stimulated by PABA, pyridoxine and thiamine.
